The bridge had a couple areas where you could get out of the walkway and pretty much be over the water. Super cool! I would definitely recommend visiting this plus its free!
Take a walk on the Helix Bridge during the evenings as it's much cooler than the daytime and you get a great view of the city lights.
Do the walk at night time and get some amazing views of the marina area, great for photos. Its an easy walk from the marina district to the Sands casino.
Beautiful pedestrian bridge. Nice views of the marina and the surrounding architectural achievements.
Wonderful architecture on this, especially at night all lit up. A highlight of the Marina Bay area at night. Definitely a must see.

We stayed in the Marina Centre area, so it was a convenient way to walk to Gardens of the Bay. It's a nice bridge, only used by pedestrians, but in the end, it's just a bridge. I wouldn't suggest making a separate trip just to see it.
Best to check out the Helix Bridge at night when the lights come on while having a stroll across, as well as avoiding the heat in the afternoon as it does not provide shelter and minimal seats.
Bridge with a twist. If you get what I mean. Cheers!! Singapore will always put something dun and exciting with all their great builds. Why not.
you can take short walk from Garden by the Bay to ArtScience Museum and Singapore River, you will find helix bridge. The architecture looks wonderfully with the lights on at night.
This bridge is very cool and aside from acting as a pedestrian walkway, it is a cool little photo spot for all.

Designed as a double helix this is an amazing pedestrian bridge linking the Promenade withe the Marina Bay Sands complex. There are view points along the bridge and be sure to visit at least once at night as the bridge is beautifully lit up and offers excellent photo opportunities. It is a popular spot for photo shoots and wedding photos and many selfies! This bridge gets very busy especially in the evenings and at weekends look out for the keep fit runners and cyclists as they can sometimes not be heard approaching.
Beautiful and very creative bridge close to the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Very nice view to the bay and to the gardens with lot of main attractions in Singapore.
I love to visit and go around this bridge at night, so many beautiful lighting.. But it's so crowded.. maybe at that time there's marina i light show..
We had a guide and we got to see the bridge, but we did not go on it. I don't feel I missed out and was happy to see it and move on.

It's a piece of art. Love it when engineering and art comes together - when it does you get something like the Helix Bridge.
Yes it's a great place for a photo of the Bay and surrounds, but also great to take a photo of the structure itself. Love the brilliant architecture that Singapore produces.
Its just a bridge with spiraling steelworks, unless you've never seen a bridge before. pass by if you really want to see it..
the helix bridge is an excellent and modern bridge building, very convenient to come from Marina Bay to the Sands Complex, modern Mall, Museum etc

The feeling of walking along the bridge is magical with the effects of the lights. From the bridge, there are spots where you can take photos and see the city. You'll also get an overwhelming view of the Marina Bay & the musuem. It is just a bridge but what makes it special is that it is formed by the design of a DNA structure.
180o views in front of you. A few scenic lookout break out points as well. All in all, a nice well built modern bridge.
Enjoyed walking across the bridge to get from Merlion Park to the Marina Bay Sands. Interesting design plus plenty of photo ops.
Nice enjoyable walk with plenty of great photo opportunities and views. Wear a hat if its a very hot day though.

The bridge that connects the marina sands skypark and the marin bay, it has an exterior platform on it where you can stop in the middle and take a photos of the city buildings view.
At night it's lighted with a purple (and maybe other colors) along the way so you feel like in some psychedelic tunnel.
Very nice place to walk.
Easy walk or scooter or bike across the bridge to get to MBS. Be rewarded at the end with air con inside the shopping centre and great views looking across the water.

REVIEW_TITLE: At The Top of The World.
REVIEW_BODY: The Helix Bridge spans the 3 Marina Bay towers and offers some spectacular views of the city of Singapore. From ground up, it is an architectural marvel in itself, serving as one of Singapore's most iconic images.

REVIEW_TITLE: A pretty bridge on Marina Bay
REVIEW_BODY: Pretty neat bridge on Marina Bay. Be sure to walk through it on the circuit from Marina Bay sands to Merlion Park.

The views from this helix bridge were terrific, especially of the lotus flower inspired design of the Art & Science Museum. The double helix design of the bridge based on the structure of DNA is fantastic. The walkway was totally accessible for me on my mobility scooter and I lived crossing it to explore more of Marina Bay.
The walk across this bridge is not long at all, so don't worry, it's not a hike. Even at a stroll, you'll be across in less than 10 minutes. It's a nice, easy place to visit.

Quick and easy way to get from Esplanade to Marina Bay Sands / Gardens by the Bay. This helix design is very unique. From the bridge, you get a view of the major tourist spots - Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade, Singpore Flyer, Science Museum to name a few.

This bridge links the Marina Bay sands area to the opposite site. The bridge is nice and looks great at night due to its light. A lot of tourist walks around here. This bridge has a viewing deck to take a picture on either Marina bay sands or the soccer field in the other side.
We were there back on 2010. But we had a great experience since it was a sunny day and the clouds look very beautiful. We had great pictures. Will be back soon. 😄
Just another place for sight seeing in Singapore. Modern architecture. A must see if you are in Singapore.

This is just a bridge so there is nothing exciting about it. But if you really have nothing better to do then go visit this bridge. Actually you would be better off walking up the Benjamin Sheares Bridge to get a bird's eye view of the singapore waterfront.
Great concept. Lights up the Marina area and a pleasant walk in the evenings. Great picture taking spots as well.

REVIEW_TITLE: Best place to get good views!
REVIEW_BODY: This is the place from where you can get good views of both the MBS on one side and the city skyline on the other. The bridge itself is also quite unique. Beautiful lighting is done in the evenings.
Beautiful and modern bridge, with an interesting view of Marina Bay. The metal structure is twined, with an amazing visual! When crossing the bridge, you must stop sometimes to take some photographs!

The bridge is very specially constructed, almost like DNA with the spirals. They also lit up with different colours at night. You can also see the beautiful view of cities of Singapore at different balconies.

The place can be very crowded at the balconies because everyone wants to take photos with the view.

This bridge joins across the bay and consider it is better visited at night time due to the very effective lighting and the views it offers to the surrounding building around the bay, always plenty of pedestrian using it
You get some spectacular views of the town and river walking over this bridge. There are bays on it for you to stop and take photos

in the day, this bridge doesn't really seem anything. however when it comes to at night, the bridge is a whole new experience where lights are brightly lit. it lets you oversee the fullerton area as well as the esplanade.

The helical structure of the bridge is interesting, nice views and some good photo op spots. You will definitely go through this if your walking from marina bay sands to the flyer. Lots of joggers on it during sunset.
The structure of this bridge is very unique, the purpose of the bridge is to connect marina bay to marina central.
It has sooooooo good view. Especially when you go there in late 6-7pm, the sunset view is incredible. Moreover, it's free and easy to access by mrt(marina bay) or bus.
A quite long bridge with very artistic design. If you go to Marina Bay Sands, please have your time to take some photos in here. Very nice.

Helix bridge is very much near to Marina Bay Sands at Marina Bay area in Singapore. Superb view during night. Good for pedestrians. If you got time then you can visit. You can get different view of Marina Bay Area
Pretty interesting bridge that you'll almost certainly walk across if you visit Marina Bay. Fairly cool design, but you don't need to spend much time here.

Was fascinated by the architecture of this bridge, all the metal work is curved and gives a really interesting walk. the reflections from the top are good. The bridge lights up at night which gives it a mystical air. Great respect for the designer.
Nice bridge for a walk. Better view at night becoz of lightings. Wad there when ilight marina was happening. Enjoyable walk and scene.

Shaped in the form of a DNA strand, the helix bridge is a beautifully architected bridge linking Marina Bay Sands to Marina Square. There are a couple of viewing platforms where you can stop to take photos of the amazing Marina Bay Sands and the bay. At night the bridge lights up with colourful lights. It is a piece of ingenuity.
Just a walk at night under the blue light. If you love photography, consider to take night photography.
This bridge features interesting architecture and engineering. Locals use the pedestrian bridge for photography, weddings, etc. Good vantage point to view the Singapore skyline too.
It's a architectical masterpiece - or at least nice to look at. Especially in the night when it's lighted up in bright colored lights
Nice place for a stroll in the evening. Lots of people and a good spot for some nice photo opportunities in the evening.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great Walk with nice views of the city
REVIEW_BODY: So we walked from the Merlion to Marina Bay Sands ( 20 mins walk) , used the Helix bridge and it is both an engineering marvel plus provides access to great views when you climb it to go towards Marina Bay Sands.

REVIEW_TITLE: Yet another master bridge in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
There are many iconic bridges in Singapore - may crossing the Singapore River - some dating back to the Colonial period. This is a very interesting bridge. Coming from the Ritz Carlton Hotel to the Art Science Museum, over the bridge was the obvious choice. Nice to look at, but don't linger as its so hot. Took some nice photos of the bridge, and breathed a sigh of relief when I reach the air conditioning of the museum.

Its a beautiful and interesting bridge. Singapore can be well proud of its architecture, with old and modern side by side. Nice views of MBS and Marina Bay.
DNA style structured metal helix bridge connects marina bay and marina centre. No vechiles there. Looks nice at night. Its short bridge. Nothing much than its design.

REVIEW_TITLE: Why is this even a tourist spot?
REVIEW_BODY: OK, so the twisting and twining structure is mimicked after our DNA. But at the end of the day, it is JUST A BRIDGE. Honestly, I do not know why this is even a talking point of a tourist spot. It is a mere convenient bridge to bring you from Marina Promenade over to Marina Bay Sands, and that's the main function. Nothing more.

i. Went there after dinner with my friend. It's a good place to walk from MBS to the Esplanade through a futsal stadium.
o Amazing design by the architect. Be blown away by the beauty of this helix bridge. Look at how thick the weld is! Wow!
ii. It is helix shape, I call it Singapore-DNA. Sleek, modern, strength in beauty, simple yet marvelous.
o Beautiful and strategic bridge in the Bay Area where one can enjoy the architecture skyline of the metropolitan.
o Wide and able to fit many. You don't feel clustered at all.
o There are small "bubble"- sections for photographic purposes. Very well thought of!
o It connects to MBS shopping centre.
x Although quite wide, I would love to have some benches so one can sit and enjoy the view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Cool photo spot and nice night view
REVIEW_BODY: It's not that big deal not to visit the bridge. The bridge has a cool design, will be good if you like to be in a cool photo spot.

Each time i go to Marina Bay Sands and Merlion, I definitely will go here too. Its just a walking distance from those places. It is decorated with led lights at night, so its just nice to go here at evening. There is also observatory place at the middle of the bridge.
jembatan penghubung dari kawasan merlion, esplanade menuju kawasan MBS. you will get amazing view at night. a good view of singapore city sight.
The helix bridge is very interesting looking and in a great spot for photos of either the skyline, the ferris wheel, MBS, or a panorama with all of them

REVIEW_TITLE: This is a destination in itself!!
REVIEW_BODY: Really interesting bridge lining the Sands Skypark with the Gardens by the Bay & the Trees. Good photo opportunity
A must visit for anyone visiting Singapore and Marina Bay. Beautiful in daytime, even better at night. Simply an architectural wonder. Be sure to bring your camera along!

We took a casual stoll across here to get to Marina Bay Skypark, and the views were great.

The bridge is a few hundred meters long, and has various sections for pedestrians to stand out and over look the harbour. Dont worry, its not just a bridge with loads of bars in the way to block your view. It really is something.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great design and great view from the bridge
REVIEW_BODY: I can see the great view from the bridge around Marina Bay. There are three spot for visitors to stop by and take a lot of pictures. The design of this bridge is also unique and nice shape.
Take a stroll along the helix bridge at night for a beautiful photo of the bridge, the skyline of business district as well as marina bay sands. Very beautiful and worth a visit.
bridge which you need to pass but its better to look at it than going on it:) fast track to get to the city from the island

REVIEW_TITLE: Interesting architectural site to behold that we drove over in Singapore late at night to catch the lights!!
REVIEW_BODY: Interesting architectural site to behold that we drove over in Singapore late at night to catch the lights!! Worth going at night to catch the light up.
It does the dual tasks of both spanning a body of water and looking beautiful very well. Is a convenient way to get to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
A lovely bridge that allows pedestrians to walk around the entire 'lagoon' without having to touch a road
We were staying at the Ritz Carlton, one end of the bridge. It connects you directly to the Marina Bay Sands Mall.
Truly a marvelous creation ... The best time to see this bridge is during night when it is all lighted up.
Just normal stainless steel truss. View around here is good you will see the Marina Bay view. But at night time the lighting here will be good.
Enjoyed this area and have a very similar picture. Nice area to enjoy the evening. Can eat outside, go to the mall, walk around, enjoy free outdoor concert while looking at the Helix Bridge.
It is just a bridge but the design and structure shows how you could make art from very simple thing and bring beauty to existence.
Located just outside the Marina Bay Sands, this bridge gives a good view of the surrounding environment. The bridge has its light lit on the evening, so you can take photo of it.

It is a good bridge during daylight and fantastic bridge at the night. Just walking distance from Garden by the bay or from Promenade MRT Station. Nearby there are also Art and Science Museum, Youth Olympic Park.

The helix bridge is much more beautiful to walk along at night! The Singapore skyline is amazingly beautiful with the different lights. You can see Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer from the Helix Bridge!
